title: How to Get Curly Hair Without a Curling Iron

methods.name: Curling Your Hair With Retro Rollers

steps.headline: Shampoo your hair at night.
steps.description: Retro rollers will add old school, bouncy curls to your hair while you sleep. Start by shampooing your hair at night.

steps.headline: Remove any tangles.
steps.description: You’ll want to use a brush or comb. This will make your hair easier to work with.

steps.headline: Run mousse through your hair.
steps.description: Your hair should be damp. Make sure to apply from your roots to your ends.

steps.headline: Choose the size of your curls.
steps.description: For Victoria’s Secret inspired hair, you’ll want to use velcro or foam rollers with a 2” diameter. The smaller the diameter of the rollers, the tighter your curls will be.

steps.headline: Divide your hair into 2” sections.
steps.description: Your hair should be slightly damp by now. If not, re-wet it with a spray bottle filled with water.

steps.headline: Wrap each section of your hair around a roller.
steps.description: You’ll always want to roll your hair starting from the ends and rolling inwards towards the roots.

steps.headline: Secure the roller with a bobby pin or a styling clip.
steps.description: You should keep wrapping, rolling, and securing until all of your hair is in rollers.

steps.headline: Get some rest.
steps.description: Your hair will set while you sleep.

steps.headline: Take out the rollers when you wake up.
steps.description: Don’t unroll them. You’ll want to pull them from the roots to brush your hair hair at the same time as taking them out.

steps.headline: Run your fingers through your hair.
steps.description: This will loosen the curls a bit for a more natural look.

steps.headline: Find an old shirt.
steps.description: You’ll want to choose one you won’t mind cutting up into pieces.

steps.headline: Cut fabric into 1” wide sections that are a few inches long.
steps.description: You may need a dozen or more sections.

steps.headline: Clean your hair.
steps.description: It’s better to do this at night so you can let your hair set while you sleep. You’ll wake up to soft curls!

steps.headline: Detangle your hair.
steps.description: A brush or comb is recommended.

steps.headline: Apply mousse to your hair.
steps.description: You’ll want to run the mousse from the roots to the ends of your hair with your fingers while your hair is still damp.

steps.headline: Select the type of curl.
steps.description: One-inch sections of hair form tighter curls. Larger sections of hair form looser curls.

steps.headline: Split your hair into sections.
steps.description: If your hair is not slightly damp, mist it with water from a spray bottle.

steps.headline: Wrap one section of your hair around one piece of the fabric you cut in the last step.
steps.description: Always start rolling your hair from the ends and roll inwards towards your scalp.

steps.headline: Tie the ends of the fabric into a knot.
steps.description: This will secure each section of hair. You should continue to wrap, roll, and secure until all of your hair is placed in fabric knots.

steps.headline: Go to sleep.
steps.description: The curls will set while you dream of sweet nothings.

steps.headline: Untie all the fabric knots when you wake up.
steps.description: You’ll want to unroll your hair at the same time.

steps.headline: Separate each coil with your fingers.
steps.description: This will loosen your hair and add volume.

steps.headline: Wash your hair in the evening.
steps.description: Braiding your hair creates waves in your hair overnight. Begin with washing your hair.

steps.headline: Brush or comb your hair.
steps.description: You’ll want to remove any tangles to make braiding your hair easier.

steps.headline: Add mousse throughout your hair.
steps.description: You’ll want to make sure you coat your hair from your roots to ends.

steps.headline: Decide how tight or loose you want your curls to be.
steps.description: 1” sections of hair form tighter curls. If you want looser curls, form larger sections.

steps.headline: Separate your hair into sections.
steps.description: At least 2 to 4 sections are recommended.

steps.headline: Braid your hair.
steps.description: You’ll want to use elastic hair ties at the ends of your braids to prevent your braids from becoming undone.

steps.headline: Go to sleep.
steps.description: Your hair will dry overnight, setting the curls.

steps.headline: Remove the elastic hair ties when you wake up.
steps.description: Elastic ties are easy to lose! Try keeping them in one spot for future use.

steps.headline: Undo the braids.
steps.description: For a more natural look, fluff your hair with your fingers.

methods.name: Curling Your Hair With Bobby Pins

steps.headline: Dampen your hair with water from a spray bottle.
steps.description: It’s not necessary to fully wet your hair. Using bobby pins will create a spiral curl look.

steps.headline: Comb or brush your hair until it’s tangle-free.
steps.description: Having smooth hair makes it easy to manipulate with your fingers.

steps.headline: Section your hair.
steps.description: You’ll want to have a top half and a bottom half. You’ll work with the lower half first, so clip the upper half on top of your head.

steps.headline: Wrap a small section from the ends of your hair.
steps.description: Keep wrapping your hair around your finger until you get to your scalp.The wider the section, the looser the curl.

steps.headline: Place a bobby pin through the section of hair wrapped around your finger.
steps.description: You’ll want to make sure that the section of hair is properly secured.

steps.headline: Continue to wrap your hair in sections.
steps.description: You are done when all of your hair is pinned to your head.

steps.headline: Let your hair dry.
steps.description: For best results, wait at least one hour.

steps.headline: Remove all the bobby pins.
steps.description: It’s easy to misplace bobby pins. Try to keep them together so you can re-use them.

steps.headline: Use your fingers to loosen the sections.
steps.description: The more loose your spiral curls are, the more natural your hairstyle will look.
